title: Drool:
content:
Did you know; Drool is really bad for a computers keyboard, and CPU.

Considering how much you drool, your CPU may be drowned.

(Though, Harvey does save big $$$ on a liquid cooling system for his PC, enough is enough)

I would recomend rubber boot; they will protect you from electric shock caused by your drownded power supply

-- NAJAWA --

title: Re: Drool:
content: It's just another spam, he knows especially well how annoying it's if someone asks "what's the problem in my computer?" without giving any details at all. Not that I'd spend my time thinking about it, but someone might. Besides, there's about a billion problems that computer can have, it's very unlikely that you'd find the answer via forum whose members have no way of inspecting the computer..Eat your veggies!

title: Re: Drool:
content:
Here's an interesting problem; a file on my comp nem220.dll swelled to over 180Mb, and started to crash IE. Anyone know what went wrong? A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

title: Re: Drool:
content:
Are you serious about that file, LL? Or just throwing out an example of how one could give specific information on a problem with their computer?
nem220.dll is a part of some spyware. It should be removed. Since the people who make spyware and adware are such jerks ("jerk" is something of a compliment for them, considering what might be a more appropriate label), just deleting this file almost certainly wont fix the problem. They almost always have many little backdoors set up so the files get reinstalled.
Suggestion, as these free tools work for me:
Ad Aware: [url=http://www.lavasoft.com/support/download/]www.lavasoft.com/support/download/[/url]
(Scroll down to the Mirror Sites.)

Spybot S&D:
[url=http://www.safer-networking.org/en/download/]www.safer-networking.org/en/download/[/url]

If you don't mind doing a little "googling" of suspicious looking processes and registry entries, "HijackThis" is very helpful for finding bad things and removing them:
[url=http://www.merijn.org/downloads.html]www.merijn.org/downloads.html[/url]

title: Re: Grrhhhh, my computor keeps crashing!
content:
Harvey,
What do you mean when you say "crashing"?
Are you talking about just stalling? Maybe it turns off? Does it "bluescreen" (or whatever Mac's do... sorry, not familiar with them.)
Any pattern to what you're doing right before it crashes?
More information is necessary.
